meanings.definition: An upright bar, post, or support used for various purposes, such as holding up a roof or barrier.
meanings.sent1: The stanchion at the entrance held up the sign.
meanings.sent2: Please lean on the stanchion to keep the line straight.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel thought the stanchion was a tree and tried to climb it.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was a stanchion in the storm of challenges she faced.
meanings.sent5: The stanchion stood tall like a soldier guarding the entrance.

meanings.definition: To support or strengthen with a stanchion.
meanings.sent1: He needed to stanchion the wobbly table leg with a wooden block.
meanings.sent2: The workers will stanchion the fence to prevent it from falling.
meanings.sent3: She decided to stanchion her confidence with positive affirmations.
meanings.sent4: His words stanchioned her resolve to pursue her dreams.
meanings.sent5: The friendship between them stanchioned their spirits during tough times.
